deck.name: B1 â€“ Intermediate Vocabulary
deck.description: Intermediate: express opinions, discuss work, health, and handle most travel situations.

cards.definition: the power or skill to do something
cards.context: She has the ability to solve complex problems.

cards.definition: a condition that puts you in a better position
cards.context: Speaking two languages is a great advantage.
Graduating from university was a huge achievement.
My aim is to speak English fluently.
She spends a large amount of time reading.

cards.definition: the way someone or something looks
cards.context: First impressions depend a lot on appearance.
They had an argument about where to go.
We made arrangements for the meeting.

cards.definition: the act of focusing the mind
cards.context: Pay attention to the instructions.

cards.definition: a way of thinking or feeling about something
cards.context: A positive attitude helps you succeed.

cards.definition: the power to give orders or make decisions
cards.context: The police have the authority to stop cars.
The average temperature in July is 25 degrees.
There is growing awareness of climate change.
It is important to find a good work-life balance.
Exercise has many health benefits.
Good behavior is expected in class.
The cause of the accident is still unknown.

cards.definition: a difficult task that tests ability
cards.context: Learning a new language is a real challenge.

cards.definition: the act of selecting between options
cards.context: You have a choice between tea and coffee.

cards.definition: a group of people living in the same area
cards.context: Our community organized a cleanup day.
There is strong competition for the job.

cards.definition: the state of something; a requirement
cards.context: The car is in good condition.
She spoke with great confidence.

cards.definition: a link between things or people
cards.context: There is a strong connection between diet and health.
Every action has consequences.

cards.definition: what is contained in something; also satisfied
cards.context: The content of the article was very informative.

cards.definition: a clear difference between two things
cards.context: There is a strong contrast between the two paintings.
Thank you for your contribution to the project.

cards.definition: the power to direct or manage
cards.context: The pilot has control of the plane.

cards.definition: a talk between two or more people
cards.context: We had an interesting conversation about travel.

cards.definition: to agree to receive or take
cards.context: She accepted the job offer.
He admitted that he was wrong.

cards.definition: to give a suggestion about what to do
cards.context: I advise you to study harder.
They announced the results this morning.
He apologized for being late.
The board approved the new plan.
They argue about politics all the time.

cards.definition: to state that something is true
cards.context: He claims to be an expert.
It is important to communicate clearly.
Please confirm your reservation by email.

cards.definition: to make someone believe something is true
cards.context: She convinced me to change my mind.

cards.definition: to say that something is not true
cards.context: He denied stealing the money.
I disagree with that statement.

cards.definition: to give support or confidence to someone
cards.context: My teacher encouraged me to apply for the scholarship.
She expressed her gratitude.
We will inform you of the results next week.
She insisted on paying for dinner.
He mentioned the meeting during lunch.

cards.definition: to cause someone to do something through reasoning
cards.context: I persuaded him to join the team.

cards.definition: to suggest as good or suitable
cards.context: I recommend this restaurant.
She refused to answer the question.
Remind me to call the dentist.
She replied to my email immediately.

cards.definition: to give an account of something
cards.context: The journalist reported the story.
I suggest we take a break.
The sign warns visitors about the cliff edge.
I applied for a new position.

cards.definition: a profession or long-term job path
cards.context: She has had a successful career in medicine.

cards.definition: a person who uses professional services
cards.context: The lawyer met with her client.
She signed a two-year contract.

cards.definition: the latest time by which something must be done
cards.context: The deadline for the report is Friday.

cards.definition: a section of a large organization
cards.context: He works in the marketing department.
The company employs 200 workers.
The tourism industry is very important here.

cards.definition: a person who runs a business or department
cards.context: The manager approved the holiday request.

cards.definition: to arrange in a systematic way
cards.context: She organized a team-building event.
She is a professional photographer.
We are working on a big project.

cards.definition: to raise to a higher position
cards.context: She was promoted to senior manager.
He qualified as a doctor last year.

cards.definition: to give up a job voluntarily
cards.context: She resigned from her position.

cards.definition: having a duty to take care of something
cards.context: He is responsible for the budget.
She plans to retire at 65.

cards.definition: a plan of events and times
cards.context: My schedule is very busy this week.
Communication is an important skill.

cards.definition: a piece of work to be done
cards.context: I completed all my tasks for the day.

cards.definition: learning skills for a specific job
cards.context: New employees receive two weeks of training.

cards.definition: an arranged meeting at a specific time
cards.context: I have a dentist appointment on Tuesday.

cards.definition: a treatment that makes a disease go away
cards.context: There is no cure for the common cold.

cards.definition: an illness that affects the body
cards.context: Heart disease is a major health problem.

cards.definition: the food a person regularly eats
cards.context: A balanced diet is important for health.
The doctor prescribed a new drug.
I do not have much energy in the afternoon.

cards.definition: the state of being physically healthy
cards.context: She goes to the gym to improve her fitness.
Smoking is a bad habit.

cards.definition: a disease caused by bacteria or viruses
cards.context: He has an ear infection.
She suffered a knee injury during the match.
Mental health is just as important as physical health.

cards.definition: a medical procedure involving cutting the body
cards.context: She had an operation on her knee.
The doctor sees about 30 patients a day.

cards.definition: to get well after an illness
cards.context: It took him two weeks to recover.
Too much stress can affect your health.
She suffers from allergies in spring.
A fever is a common symptom of the flu.
The doctor treated the wound.
I need to lose some weight.

cards.definition: the state of being healthy and happy
cards.context: The company cares about employee wellbeing.

cards.definition: the usual weather conditions in a region
cards.context: The climate here is mild and rainy.
I prefer living in the countryside.
There was a huge crowd at the concert.

cards.definition: the customs and beliefs of a group of people
cards.context: I enjoy learning about other cultures.

cards.definition: the system of money and trade in a country
cards.context: The economy has been growing steadily.

cards.definition: the process of choosing a leader by voting
cards.context: The election will be held in November.
We must protect the environment.

cards.definition: the group of people who run a country
cards.context: The government announced new taxes.

cards.definition: the power to affect people or events
cards.context: Social media has a strong influence on young people.
Climate change is a global issue.

cards.definition: a rule made by the government
cards.context: There is a new law about recycling.

cards.definition: a position on a scale; a floor of a building
cards.context: Your English is at an intermediate level.

cards.definition: newspapers, TV, and internet as a group
cards.context: The media reported on the election results.

cards.definition: the physical world, including plants and animals
cards.context: I love spending time in nature.

cards.definition: a person living next door or nearby
cards.context: Our neighbors are very friendly.
Air pollution is a serious problem in big cities.

cards.definition: the number of people living in a place
cards.context: The population of this city is growing.

cards.definition: the state of being very poor
cards.context: Many families still live in poverty.

cards.definition: an area of a country or the world
cards.context: This region is known for its wine.

cards.definition: people living together as a group
cards.context: Technology has changed modern society.

cards.definition: a custom passed down through generations
cards.context: It is a tradition to eat turkey on Thanksgiving.

cards.definition: to make a choice in an election
cards.context: Everyone should vote in the election.

cards.definition: materials thrown away; to use carelessly
cards.context: Do not waste water.
She achieved her dream of becoming a pilot.
The weather affects my mood.
Smoking is not allowed in the building.
A rainbow appeared after the rain.
We approached the entrance slowly.
She arranged a surprise party.

cards.definition: to accept something as true without proof
cards.context: I assumed the shop was open on Sunday.
He attempted to climb the wall.

cards.definition: to be present at an event
cards.context: I will attend the conference next week.
Try to avoid making the same mistake.

cards.definition: to act in a particular way
cards.context: The children behaved well at the restaurant.

cards.definition: to decide that something will not happen
cards.context: They cancelled the flight due to bad weather.

cards.definition: to ask for payment; to supply with power
cards.context: They charge five euros for parking.
Combine the ingredients in a bowl.
He committed to running every day.

cards.definition: to try to win against others
cards.context: The teams compete for the trophy.
This issue concerns all of us.

cards.definition: to make unclear or difficult to understand
cards.context: The instructions confused me.
Connect your phone to the Wi-Fi.
I am considering moving abroad.
The box contains twelve pencils.
She created a beautiful painting.
The storm damaged several houses.

cards.definition: to become smaller in number or amount
cards.context: Sales have decreased this quarter.

cards.definition: to bring something to a person or place
cards.context: The package was delivered this morning.
The workers demanded higher wages.
It depends on the weather.
She designed the new company logo.
The fire destroyed the old building.
The company is developing a new product.
The sun disappeared behind the clouds.
Divide the cake into eight pieces.
She earns a good salary.
I want to emphasize the importance of teamwork.
Technology enables us to work from home.
Please ensure all windows are closed.
The company was established in 1990.
I estimate the trip will take two hours.
The doctor examined the patient.
Do aliens exist?
The company is expanding into new markets.
I expect the train to arrive on time.

cards.definition: to travel through an area to learn about it
cards.context: We explored the old town on foot.
He failed the driving test twice.
She gained valuable experience abroad.
Solar panels generate electricity.
She handles pressure very well.
Can you identify the problem?
She ignored my phone calls.
I want to improve my pronunciation.

cards.definition: to become greater in size or number
cards.context: The price of petrol has increased.
The sign indicates the exit.

cards.definition: to include as a necessary part
cards.context: The job involves a lot of travel.

cards.definition: to be in charge of; to succeed in doing
cards.context: He manages a team of ten people.

cards.definition: to find the size or amount of something
cards.context: Measure the length of the room.
The accident occurred at midnight.

cards.definition: to function or work; to perform surgery
cards.context: The machine operates automatically.

cards.definition: to carry out an action; to act on stage
cards.context: The band performed live at the festival.
Cameras are not permitted in the museum.
Washing your hands helps prevent illness.
The factory produces cars.
We must protect endangered animals.
The hotel provides free breakfast.

cards.definition: to make available to the public
cards.context: She published her first novel last year.
Raise your hand if you have a question.

cards.definition: to arrive at; to stretch out to touch
cards.context: We reached the summit at noon.
I realized I had left my wallet at home.
We need to reduce waste.

cards.definition: to make a connection between things
cards.context: How does this relate to our project?

cards.definition: to set free or make available
cards.context: The company released a new product.
You can rely on me for help.

cards.definition: to stay in the same place or condition
cards.context: Please remain seated until the plane stops.
Please remove your shoes before entering.

cards.definition: to put something new in place of
cards.context: We need to replace the old batteries.
This job requires good communication skills.

cards.definition: to admire or show consideration for
cards.context: We should respect other people\

cards.definition: to give an answer or reaction
cards.context: She responded to the email quickly.
His injury resulted from poor training.
The study revealed surprising results.
Let me review the document before sending it.
Select the correct answer.
Separate the white clothes from the colored ones.

cards.definition: to find the answer to a problem
cards.context: We need to solve this issue quickly.
The news spread quickly.
He struggled to keep up with the class.
If you work hard, you will succeed.
The company supplies food to restaurants.
My family supports my decision.

cards.definition: to continue living after a danger
cards.context: She survived the earthquake.

cards.definition: to be likely to do something
cards.context: I tend to wake up early.
Can you translate this word into English?
The report needs to be accurate.
She was anxious about the results.
Wear appropriate clothing for the interview.

He has a basic understanding of Spanish.
The meeting was very brief.
Stay calm during the emergency.
This is a complex problem.
I was confused by the directions.
There is constant noise from the traffic.

cards.definition: easy to use or suitable for your needs
cards.context: The hotel is in a convenient location.

cards.definition: able to produce new and original ideas
cards.context: She has a very creative mind.
What is the current situation?
Children are naturally curious.

cards.definition: sad because something did not meet expectations
cards.context: I was disappointed with the result.

He was embarrassed by the mistake.
They live in an enormous house.
I spent the entire day reading.
Water is essential for life.

That is a fair decision.
This place looks familiar.

cards.definition: able to change or be changed easily
cards.context: We have flexible working hours.

His surprise was genuine.
I am grateful for your help.
He felt guilty about lying.

Each individual has different needs.

cards.definition: able to learn and understand quickly
cards.context: He is an intelligent student.
I shop at the local market.
Traffic is a major problem in the city.

cards.definition: existing in nature, not made by people
cards.context: This juice is made from natural ingredients.
It is necessary to book in advance.
Try not to focus on negative thoughts.
The answer was obvious.
Is there a particular reason you called?

cards.definition: able to wait without becoming annoyed
cards.context: Please be patient, the doctor will see you soon.
I am pleased with the results.
Try to stay positive.
I have experience from my previous job.

cards.definition: personal; not for others to know
cards.context: That is a private matter.
Snow is rare in this region.
The price is very reasonable.

cards.definition: happening or done not long ago
cards.context: I read about it in a recent article.

cards.definition: happening at the same time or in the same way
cards.context: Regular exercise keeps you healthy.
Only include relevant information.
This is a serious problem.
There has been a significant improvement.
The school has strict rules about phones.

A typical day at work starts at nine.

cards.definition: worth a lot of money; very useful
cards.context: She gave me valuable advice.
The shop sells various kinds of bread.
I actually prefer the blue one.

cards.definition: it seems; according to what is said
cards.context: Apparently, the concert is sold out.
The journey takes approximately two hours.
The weather is gradually getting warmer.
Call the doctor immediately.
I will cook dinner. Meanwhile, you can set the table.
I mostly work from home.

cards.definition: in a different way; or else
cards.context: Hurry up, otherwise we will be late.
Make sure the door is closed properly.
He was ill and therefore could not come.

cards.definition: used to talk about a choice between possibilities
cards.context: I do not know whether to go or stay.

cards.definition: inside; in less than a certain time
cards.context: We will deliver within 24 hours.

The flight was cancelled due to fog.
In addition to English, she speaks German.
In fact, the movie was better than I expected.
She studied hard in order to pass the exam.

cards.definition: used to present a different viewpoint
cards.context: The salary is low. On the other hand, the hours are flexible.

cards.definition: the ability to enter or use something
cards.context: The building has wheelchair access.

cards.definition: a piece of writing in a newspaper
cards.context: I read an interesting article about space.

cards.definition: a feature or part of something
cards.context: This is an important aspect of the plan.

cards.definition: the amount of money available to spend
cards.context: We need to stay within our budget.

cards.definition: a period of a hundred years
cards.context: The castle was built in the 15th century.

cards.definition: a condition or fact surrounding an event
cards.context: Under the circumstances, we had no choice.

cards.definition: the act of comparing two things
cards.context: There is no comparison between the two restaurants.

cards.definition: a unit of measurement; a university qualification
cards.context: She has a degree in engineering.

cards.definition: the amount of space between two points
cards.context: The distance between the two cities is 200 kilometers.

cards.definition: the use of energy to do something

The phone has many useful features.
His monthly income covers the rent.

cards.definition: more than half of a group
cards.context: The majority of students passed the exam.

cards.definition: a substance things are made from
cards.context: The dress is made of natural material.

cards.context: The application process takes two weeks.

cards.definition: how good or bad something is
cards.context: This hotel offers good quality at a fair price.

cards.definition: a variety of things; a set of limits

cards.definition: the speed or frequency of something
cards.context: The crime rate has decreased.

cards.definition: a careful study to discover facts
cards.context: She is doing research on climate change.

cards.definition: a duty you are expected to carry out
cards.context: It is your responsibility to lock the door.

cards.definition: the possibility of something bad happening

cards.definition: the conditions and circumstances at a time
cards.context: It was a difficult situation.

cards.context: She gave a great speech at the conference.

cards.definition: a level of quality considered acceptable
cards.context: The standard of teaching is very high.

cards.definition: the way parts are arranged together
cards.context: The structure of the essay is clear.

cards.definition: the use of science in industry and everyday life
cards.context: Technology is changing the way we work.

cards.definition: an idea used to explain something
cards.context: In theory, the plan should work.

cards.definition: the importance or worth of something
cards.context: Education has great value.

cards.definition: an opinion; what you can see from a place
cards.context: The view from the window is beautiful.

cards.definition: the amount of sound; the space inside
cards.context: Turn down the volume, please.
